member.name: T:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxNoCacheFilterAttribute
member.summary: Causes all ajax request to not be cached by the browser.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxNoCacheFilterAttribute.OnResultExecuting(System.Web.Mvc.ResultExecutingContext)
member.summary: Called by the ASP.NET MVC framework before the action result executes.

member.name: T:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxOnlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method can only be called from an Ajax request.
member.gist: Decorate your method or class with the AjaxOnly attribute and it will only be able to be called via ajax.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxOnlyAttribute.IsValidForRequest(System.Web.Mvc.ControllerContext,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Determines whether the action method selection is valid for the specified controller context.
member.returns: true if the action method selection is valid for the specified controller context; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute
member.summary: This checks the request headers for the request verification token if the request is an ajax request.
member.gist: Decorate your method with the validation attribute
In your ajax call to post the data, you will want to do something like the following:
member.remarks: This attribute will work in place of ValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.AjaxValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute.OnAuthorization(System.Web.Mvc.AuthorizationContext)
member.summary: Called when authorization is required.

member.name: T:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.CompressAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the requests should be compressed using the methods accepted by the clients browser. (GZIP or DEFLATE)

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.CompressAttribute.OnResultExecuted(System.Web.Mvc.ResultExecutedContext)
member.summary: Called by the ASP.NET MVC framework after the action result executes.

member.summary: Indicates that the request should never be cached by the browser.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.NoCacheAttribute.OnResultExecuting(System.Web.Mvc.ResultExecutingContext)
member.summary: Called by the ASP.NET MVC framework before the action result executes.

member.name: T:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.RobotsDisallowAttribute
member.summary: Describes that the controller, area, or action should be not visited by a web crawler robot.
member.gist: Disallow a specific Action within a Controller
Setup the web.config for handling the robots.txt requests.

member.name: P:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Attributes.RobotsDisallowAttribute.Area
member.summary: Gets or sets the area.
member.value: This helps get the area information when building the robots.txt.
member.remarks: This can be left empty if the attribute is on an AreaRegistration.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Extensions.CamalotCommonMvcExtensions.UrlEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Encodes a URL string using the specified encoding object.
member.param: The Encoding object that specifies the encoding scheme.
member.remarks: This method can be used to encode the entire URL, including query-string values. If characters such as blanks and punctuation are passed in an HTTP stream, they might be misinterpreted at the receiving end. URL encoding converts characters that are not allowed in a URL into character-entity equivalents; URL decoding reverses the encoding. For example, when the characters < and > are embedded in a block of text to be transmitted in a URL, they are encoded as %3c and %3e.

member.name: M:Camalot.Common.Mvc.Extensions.CamalotCommonMvcExtensions.UrlDecode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: URL decodes a string.
